summary: This document is an email chain from November 10, 2020, forwarding a letter from the Marsh Law Firm concerning a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss the letter's routing within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and mention a Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) agent's potential involvement in analyzing images through the National Center for Missing & Exploited Children (NCMEC).

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The primary recipient of the forwarded letter from Jennifer Freeman of the Marsh Law Firm. The email chain discusses routing the victim letter to her.

persons.name: Jennifer Freeman
persons.role: Attorney at Marsh Law Firm PLLC
persons.context: Sent the original letter concerning a potential Epstein/Maxwell victim to Audrey Strauss. She is identified as working for the Marsh Law Firm.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as an alleged perpetrator of abuse against the victim discussed in the forwarded letter.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Epstein as an alleged perpetrator of abuse against the victim discussed in the forwarded letter.

connections.description: Freeman, an attorney, sent a confidential letter concerning a potential victim to Strauss at the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Both are mentioned together as alleged perpetrators in the abuse of the victim discussed in the letter.

events.title: Forwarding of Victim Letter
events.description: An email chain forwards a letter from the Marsh Law Firm to the U.S. Attorney's Office concerning a potential victim of Epstein and Maxwell, discussing its proper handling.

keyFacts: The Marsh Law Firm, known for aggressively representing victims of child pornography, sent a letter to the U.S. Attorney's Office about a potential Epstein/Maxwell victim.

The email chain reveals internal DOJ procedures for handling such victim correspondence, noting the Civilian Crime Reports (CCR) unit forwards but does not act on it if it concerns a statutory victim of a charged case.
An HSI agent is mentioned in the context of potentially running images to the National Center for Missing & Exploited Children (NCMEC) for identification.
The document highlights ongoing legal and investigative activity related to Epstein/Maxwell victims as of November 2020.
